title: Batak Toba (1867) Mark
description: The Gospel of Mark translated into Batak Toba by H.N. Van Der Tuuk in 1867. Van der Tuuk was a Bible translator and linguist specializing in the languages of the Dutch East. The Batak Toba are the most numerous of the Batak people of North Sumatra, Indonesia, and often considered the classical 'Batak', most likely to willingly self-identify as Batak.

language.name: Batak Toba
language.area: North Sumatra, Samosir Island and east, south, and west of Toba Lake.
